svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Remove the bolts, the rear bearing cover, and gasket ( Figure 72). If necessary, remove the oil seal from the cover ( inset, Figure 72).

figure.caption: Figure 72. Remove Bolts, Rear Bearing Cover, Gasket, and Oil Seal

step1.para: If not previously done, remove the snap ring and speedometer drive gear or replacement spacer from the output shaft of models so equipped ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Remove Snap Ring and Speedometer Drive Gear or Replacement Spacer

step1.para: Temporarily re-install the rear bearing cover in position on the housing ONLY to catch rear bearing cone released from the bore in the following procedure ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Temporarily Re-install Rear Bearing Cover

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to drive the output shaft forward and through the rear bearing assembly ( Figure 75). This will cause the rear bearing cone to be released from the bore in the auxiliary housing.

figure.caption: Figure 75. Drive Output Shaft Forward and Through Rear Bearing Assembly

note.para: When applying force to the rear of the output shaft, DO NOT DAMAGE THREADS. Support the front of the shaft to avoid damaging the mainshaft quill once the output shaft is free of the bearing.

step1.para: Remove the rear bearing cover and bearing cone ( Figure 76).

figure.caption: Figure 76. Remove Rear Bearing Cover and Bearing Cone

step1.para: Remove the two bearing cups and outer spacer from the bore in the auxiliary housing ( Figure 77).

figure.caption: Figure 77. Remove Bearing Cups and Outer Spacer
